Module Projet.Biblio
Package Projet.Biblio.Screen

Class ScreensController

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
Projet.Biblio.Screen.ScreensController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class ScreensController extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
Controller class for managing different screens in the application. This class extends StackPane and provides methods to add, load, set, and unload screens.

  • Property Summary

  • Method Details

    • addScreen

      public void addScreen(String name, javafx.scene.Node screen)
      Adds a screen to the collection.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the screen
      screen - the node representing the screen

    • getScreen

      public javafx.scene.Node getScreen(String name)
      Retrieves the Node with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the screen
      Returns:
      the Node representing the screen

    • loadScreen

      public boolean loadScreen(String name, String resource)
      Loads an FXML file representing a screen and adds it to the screens collection.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the screen
      resource - the resource path of the FXML file
      Returns:
      true if the screen is successfully loaded, false otherwise

    • setScreen

      public boolean setScreen(String name)
      Sets the specified screen to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the screen to be displayed
      Returns:
      true if the screen is successfully set, false otherwise

    • unloadScreen

      public boolean unloadScreen(String name)
      Removes the screen with the specified name from the screens collection.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the screen to be unloaded
      Returns:
      true if the screen is successfully unloaded, false otherwise
